title: Various Artists - Mojo's Blue Christmas
description:
Various Artists
Blue Christmas
Alternative Christmas
2005
320Kbps 

---------------------------------------------------------------------
                       Tracklisting
---------------------------------------------------------------------

   1. (00:05:16) The Flaming Lips - A Change At Christmas
   2. (00:03:20) Rufus Wainwright - Spotlight On Christmas
   3. (00:02:48) Marvin Gaye - Purple Snowflakes
   4. (00:02:27) The Staple Singers - Who Took The Merry Out Of Christmas
   5. (00:02:14) The O'Jays - Christmas Ain't Christmas
   6. (00:02:47) Charles Brown - Please Come Home For Christmas
   7. (00:04:34) David McAlmont & David Arnold - Have Yourself A Merry Christmas
   8. (00:02:50) A Girl Called Eddy - The Little Boy That Santa Claus Forgot
   9. (00:06:28) James Brown - Lets Make Christmas Mean Something
  10. (00:05:50) Neal Casal - Cora Jones
  11. (00:03:46) The Handsome Family - So Much Wine
  12. (00:02:23) Diana Ross & The Supremes - Just A Lonely Christmas
  13. (00:04:35) Ed Harcourt - In the Bleak Midwinter
  14. (00:02:37) B B King - Christmas Celebration
  15. (00:01:58) The Ventures - Jingle Bell Rock

Included.............: NFO, M3U
Covers...............: Front 

Playing Time.........: 00:53:52
Total Size...........: 123.42 MB

Are you tired of the same old christmas songs? want some seasonal music but don't want to compromise on your musical tastes just because of the holidays? then check out this compilation of alternative christmas songs which as the subtitle suggests are made up of songs of faith, hope and misery in equal measure. From the aptly titled opener by the flaming lips "a change at christmas" which paves the way nicely for the rest of the album suggesting there needs to be a change but also promising that there is hope for the future and that just maybe things will be alright. The sweet soulful sounds of classic artists such as Marvin Gaye, the O'Jays, The Staple Singers and James Brown rubbing shoulders with slightly more alternative artists such as A Girl Called Eddy, Neal Casal and The Handsome Family who plumb the depths of seasonal misery. Throw in a couple of traditional songs one of which is beautifully covered by McAlmont & Arnold and the Other by Ed Harcourt, finish it all off with a couple of rocking upbeat entries from BB King and The Ventures which bring the festivities to a close nicely, lifting the holiday depression and leaving you feeling like maybe it wasn't so bad after all.

Enjoy :)
